ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] "-6 Prerequisite domain-lookup failed" continues after temporary DNS failure
ygData.msgSnippet: I m not sure, but I think force-importing the *DNS* URIs that failed (rather than the URIs that need them as prerequisites), and letting those DNS requests

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] "-6 Prerequisite domain-lookup failed" continues
 after temporary DNS failure
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Rfqeyq4Cz2XjN8Mj5b48u0r3Pc8WI0nBry8aVbMpuUnj
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I'm not sure, but I think force-importing the *DNS* URIs that failed 
(rather than the URIs that need them as prerequisites), and letting 
those DNS requests finish, will cause the CrawlHost/CrawlServer states 
to be updated, and no longer stuck as 'unresolvable'.

Then the other URIs either won't need a DNS prerequisite at all, or 
(after the domain-name info truly expires) a regular re-lookup will occur.

It's *probably* good enough to ensure the 'dns:' URIs are just listed 
before the HTTP URIs in one batch-import... since they'll then be before 
the HTTP URIs in the queue.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon

On 3/3/14, 3:01 AM, Bert Wendland wrote:
>
> Hello,
>
> Our DNS was down for a couple of hours and a lot of URLs in our running
> jobs got rejected with "-6 Prerequisite domain-lookup failed". When the
> DNS was back (and after waiting much longer than the time specified in
> Preprocessor/ip-validity-duration-seconds), I extracted these URLs and
> reimported them into the job in the hope that Heritrix would recrawl them.
> But it didn't. All the URLs were immediately rejected with the same -6
> status, without any DNS request. There's no problem in doing DNS lookup
> for any other application (nslookup, curl, wget, ...) on the same machine.
>
> Is there any way to convince Heritrix to change the status of those URLs?
> I wouldn't like to restart the jobs completely as they are nearly at the
> end. Any help would be appreciated. We are still running Heritrix 1.14.4.
>
> Thanks in advance,
>     Bert
